title: Crager denies allegations of fraud in Saunders case
text:
Crager denies allegations of fraud in Saunders case Daniel Paulling, The Clarion-Ledger 7:09 p.m. CDT October 16, 2015 Ginny Crager denies NCAA allegations against her following investigation linked to former Ole Miss coach David Saunders. (Photo: Spruce Derden, Spruce Derden-USA TODAY Sports) 1 CONNECT 2 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
OXFORD — An alleged participant named in an NCAA investigation concerning possible ACT test fraud and linked to former Ole Miss coach David Saunders has denied involvement. 
Ginny Crager, who previously administered the ACT at Wayne County High School, called all NCAA allegations against herself and Saunders false in a sworn affidavit released this week to the (Lafayette, Louisiana) Advertiser following the newspaper’s open records request. 
“That neither David Saunders nor anyone at Louisiana Lafayette University (sic) nor the University of Mississippi ever asked me to nor did I ever alter any ACT test nor did I violate any ACT rules in the administration of the ACT test at any time,” she said in the affidavit . 
The NCAA’s Notice of Allegations sent to the University of Louisiana-Lafayette alleges Saunders, who was an assistant coach there, arranged for six recruits to take the ACT at Wayne County, where someone proctoring the exam allegedly altered the answer sheets. Ole Miss linked to NCAA investigation at ULL 
Louisiana-Lafayette’s 78-page response to the allegations said Ole Miss conducted an interview in December 2013 with Saunders and an athlete he had previously been recruiting to Ole Miss and completed an interview with Crager in February 2014. 
“Through the course of those interviews, it became apparent to (Louisiana-Lafayette associate director of athletics for academics and compliance Jessica) Lager that the enforcement staff was testing information that suggested Saunders knew of, or had been involved in, NCAA rules violations of an academic nature while employed at Ole Miss,” the response reads. 
Saunders worked for Ole Miss on three separate occasions: from 1998 to 2002, in 2006 and in 2010. He joined the Louisiana-Lafayette coaching staff in January 2011 after his third stint with the Rebels but was fired in October 2014. 
He is now an assistant coach at Pearl River Community College. Saunders declined a request for comment through the school’s sports information department.
